conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/elevated cutaway: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, and the ceiling/roof is removed to reveal interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall thickness and corners; clear floor-vs-wall separation; good cutaway. Minor softness in some wall top edges/joins reduces geometric crispness slightly.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set and adjacency match (open lounge/dining to left, kitchen central, two bedrooms to right, bath/WC core, separate garage). Some proportional differences (bedroom sizes and core corridor widths feel altered), and a few opening placements are hard to verify precisely from this view.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen cabinetry/appliances are present; bedrooms have simplified furniture blocks; bathroom fixtures are only partially/weakly represented. Some rooms are sparsely furnished relative to plan intent.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation, no UI/text contamination in the 3D render; lighting and materials allow reading walls/openings. Slight blur/low detail makes door swings and some partitions less distinct.

detected_errors.description: Noticeable proportional drift in some spaces (notably bedroom/core corridor widths) compared to the 2D plan, though overall layout/adjoinments remain consistent.
Door/window placement and sizing cannot be confirmed as fully faithful from the given angle/detail; some openings appear simplified.
Furniture/fixtures are simplified and incomplete (bathroom fixtures especially), reducing confidence in room identity fidelity.

summary: A genuine cutaway 3D model with strong volumetric correctness and broadly faithful layout, with moderate proportional and opening-detail mismatches versus the 2D plan.
